website_summaries.verdict: A fun, concrete way to give your child a head start in the  basic Kindergarten skill of counting to 100.
pros: Grid with 100 spaces for numbers 1 to 100
Kids learn about counting and patterns
Helps with skip counting, a precursor to multiplication
Can use later to learn multiplication tables
cons: Some numbers are slightly small to read
Tiles pose a choking hazard for children under age 3
Supervise if an older child uses around a younger one

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This product is sturdy, yet not overbuilt. It comes with a paper number chart and a cloth sack for the tiles, has one side solid and the other with a grid, and all fits neatly into a gallon ziplock. I’m looking forward to using this to help solidify number sequencing with my four-year-old.
customer_reviews.author: K-mommy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Kindergarten
customer_reviews.text: This is great for teaching number recognition and learning to count to 100. I wish I had bought this sooner! The rule in our home is that you have to to say the number aloud when you're placing the tile down. We've made copies of the back paper and have colored the evens and odds, 5s, each row, etc. I took off one star for the 6s and 9s. You really have to look hard to identify 6 versus 9. Hint: the spacing below the number is slightly smaller than the spacing above the number.
customer_reviews.author: E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: It is light but strong, kids love it! And we as teachers strongly recommend it because of its fine details. It brings a little sack for the number tiles, which is perfect to keep the set in order.
customer_reviews.author: Laura BW

customer_reviews.title: good learning tool, could be made sturdier.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice piece, but I guess I expected it to be a bit thicker? The puzzle board itself is pretty light and thin, as are the number chips. It's a great puzzle still, and I know my little puzzler will love it. I got this because I remembered doing one as a kid, but the numbers were cubes, and the board was heavier and bigger. I know this type of toy greatly helps with learning numbers from my experience as a kid. It helped me see patterns and get ahead in math because I had a better understanding of how the numbers related to one another based on seeing them this way.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It provides a good learning and useful source for basic numbers. It also stimulates fine motor, visual and perceptual skills in kids. Nonetheless, it is hard not to lose any those little pieces without an extra large bag to place everything inside.
customer_reviews.author: Tzu-Hui Chan

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my six year old, first grader. She needed to practice her counting to 100 after summer break, and she loves jigsaw puzzles, so this was a fun enticing way for her to get her practice in. She's also practicing her skip counting. She's done the board every day after school for the last week since it's arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Clover

customer_reviews.title: nice product!
customer_reviews.text: nice quality of number tiles! this will help my 3 yr old son better familiarize with numbers upto 100! although it would be nicer if it's a bit bigger 🙃
customer_reviews.author: CDG

customer_reviews.title: crooked = tiles don’t align
customer_reviews.text: They glued/attached the grid paper with the squares on crooked so the tiles don’t go on the numbered squares perfectly. For a child (my 4 year old), this is confusing and also frustrating. Bad quality control. This could have easily been caught/fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pieces slide all over the place
customer_reviews.text: I was an elementary teacher in a Reggjo/Montessori/Waldorf hybrid school (don’t ask). I value wooden toys and materials and buy them over plastic for my homeschooled sons. While a hundreds board is an excellent tool, this one misses the mark. My kinder age boy became too frustrated (and I did as well) with the numbers sliding all over the mat when he placed them or slightly bumped the board. This detracted from his ability to persist through the task or focus on the actual numeracy work. His fine motor is very typical for a child his age. I am returning and unfortunately might have to get a plastic board where each square on the mat has a lip.
customer_reviews.author: Homeschoolin’Momma

customer_reviews.title: This had such great potential but they keep falling apart
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 0 stars, I would. I ordered two boards, neither of the frames are secured. This had such great potential but they keep falling apart!
customer_reviews.author: D. Laird

customer_reviews.title: Not a best purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it for my 4 years old. I was expecting little bigger but it is very small for kids to whom you want to teach numbers from starch. Also the 100 counting sheet is just a print in a small sheet with very bad ink as in after few weeks of usage by kid the ink with which numbers are written is getting fade. Quality wise it is ok but not worth the money we are investing it should be at least little more bigger if not then definitely cheaper than what they are selling for.
customer_reviews.author: Mimilovestoshop

customer_reviews.title: Very small and thin. Tiny.
customer_reviews.text: This board is very small. Open Your hand and spread your fingers. It is as wide as from your thumb to your pinky (average man hand). It's just not worth the $16 I paid for it, and I've seen this same one made in China elsewhere for ten bucks. The wood is sturdy. But it's a tiny board. Really small. And thin.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Good, wish there were raised edges to hold in place
customer_reviews.text: Tiles worked well for my four and two year olds to put on board. There are not raised edges to keep numbers from moving around (which would improve its design).
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Overpeck

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT !!!
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality & sturdiness is the main factor. A great learning project for kids. The board comes numbered and the pieces are numbered making it easier for the kids to learn. Then the board is also reversible so you can flip it and let the kids put the numbers together without the number guide. It’s magnificent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Placed tiles don’t stay in place, frustration abounds.
customer_reviews.text: Little number tiles and no real holding areas for the tiles on the board. Son tried to put them in order, they would move when he bumped them. He didn’t even get to twenty before the frustration was too much.
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: Has been a homeschool favorite
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Montessori task for 3/4+ kids. My son is using it as a kindergarten student he attended Montessori and now we are doing at home school of course. There are a lot of fun games and activities that can be extended with this material.
customer_reviews.author: #1Docmom

customer_reviews.title: Not to recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed. The numbers are too small and the frame fall apart when I take it out the box not even stay one hour. Poor quality material but fast shipping .
customer_reviews.author: Nati

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: I wish there were raised sides between each number so that they did not slide around as my children try to arrange the numbers. This has caused frusteration making it less enjoyable for kids. It was a good visual for skip counting but that could have been achieved with a print out.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyP

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality for the price. The tile sizes can be handled easily by child and adult. The only thing I did was put twenty tiles (1-20 and so forth) each in baggies so finding the next correct number my child isn’t looking through a hundred.
customer_reviews.author: Dejae

customer_reviews.title: Not functional
customer_reviews.text: This is way to slippery to use as intended and the squares do not line up well. Tiny fingers trying to lay a tile send all the other tiles out of line. My five year old was so frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Hein

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This is fine for the price. It's smaller than I thought it would be. If you're looking for an actual Montessori Hundreds Board, this is not it. However, the product itself is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dahlia82

customer_reviews.title: Surpass expectations
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. (Can use on dinning table without crowding) Smooth surface. Solid build. Clearly printed. All in all, impeccably made. Also, no odor whatsoever. VERY happy purchase.
customer_reviews.author: readersread

customer_reviews.title: So small kinda disappointing
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok but it’s hard to put the squares down because they are TINY. The pieces move around as you are putting them down. I’ll probably try learning resources version
customer_reviews.author: CeCeSeventy7

customer_reviews.title: My 5 year old loves! Great price for quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great resource for a homeschooling family! We can count to 100 or by 2’s or by 5’s. It’s a great visual! As soon as we opened it my 5 year old daughter has been counting! Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Ambrosia Ayde

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this was for my classroom and I didn’t open it for over a month. But 5 number tiles were missing from the beginning. Bummer I can’t return it at this point. Tiles are very small and can be hard for some students with fine motor deficits to manipulate.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great but the pieces are small.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my first grade classroom. My students enjoy using it. I just wish the pieces were larger especially since first graders are still reading with primary print.
customer_reviews.author: ProudMother

customer_reviews.title: This will work well
customer_reviews.text: These are a good quality for the price. We have been using them with all the grandchildren and they are working great.
customer_reviews.author: cn/mn

customer_reviews.title: Great for little hands
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old absolutely loves this set! He loves numbers and plays with this a lot. I love that the pieces are wooden and hold up to all the handling. However, the pieces are very small, so I would suggest this only for younger children. One side of the board did come off but I was able to put it back on with wood glue with no problem. The numbers come with a convenient cloth pouch to hold them.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a nanny, so this is perfect for what I needed it for. For the price, it cant be beat! May not hold up too well if it's being used in a classroom with multiple children handling it constantly, but it might!
customer_reviews.author: Southern Belle

customer_reviews.title: Served its purpose!
customer_reviews.text: Used the numbers for raffle. Looked pretty in glass bowl & numbers are easy to read and handle.
customer_reviews.author: AMW

customer_reviews.title: Kept my kids busy for hours!
customer_reviews.text: What a simple and wonderful product. High quality pieces (the wooden numbers are similar to Scrabble tiles) and many ways to use it. My kids are loving finding the numbers or just playing with them. Great for understanding how numbers work together and have patterns. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Mazanowski

customer_reviews.title: Quite small
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I imagined. Also attention to the small pieces. It can be a choking hazard if it is for little ones. Requires adult supervision.
customer_reviews.author: P.C.

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it for a Math Center/activity for my Kinder class. Although the pieces seem small, they are perfect for little hands. My daughter in 2nd grade also LOVED "playing" with it.
customer_reviews.author: Neela Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this at her Montessori school, decided during quarantine that I'd get one for her to use. Great for helping solve math problems, also kind of therapeutic for her to sit down and just place them all on the board, she's an ADHD kid and can sit for 20+ minutes messing with it. She says it's just like the one at school just smaller, it was smaller than I expected but gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: good for my toddler
customer_reviews.text: this one really amazing, at 4 my daughter knows how to do this and now that she is kinder no problem for her in counting 100. 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Savvy J

customer_reviews.title: Great success with my 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: This was a hit with my 5 year old, he loves it and wants to use it almost daily. We cover the numbers with Pom poms or coins and he has to guess which number comes next.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: good not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because a few of the numbers on the card and on the wooden squares weren’t printed all the way. You can still read the numbers fine, but it isn’t perfect as it should be. Great other than that.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Mitro

customer_reviews.title: It's not what I want
customer_reviews.text: This product is also too small, I thought it would be very big, children play is not comfortable, write Numbers of the small square is not easy to use!

customer_reviews.title: Very cute

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for preschoolers
customer_reviews.text: Good math manipulative for preschoolers. It’s small but worth it he can now memorize the 1 to 100 even without looking at the sheets

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Not at all what I had hoped for. It was so tiny and not very practical for little children.

customer_reviews.title: Great Summer Tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great summer tool. My six year old counts by 2s, 5s, 10s 11s.... She is having fun and learning.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing deal, so cheap for a 100s board and it's a great quality. A Montessori must have

customer_reviews.text: The pieces are smaller than I thought they would be but a solid tool in any early Montessori classroom
customer_reviews.author: Dhawn

customer_reviews.title: Wish they were magnetic.
customer_reviews.text: I like this learning tool a lot. It really helps my 4 year old with learning numbers. I wish it was magnetic so the tiles would stay in place when he is sorting them out alone.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny

customer_reviews.text: It is well made and sturdy. The only thing is the hundred chart is just a card stock and can be easily damaged by the kids. So I wish they were laminated or at least coated.

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: We did not get the numbers with it. The package was open

customer_reviews.title: many different activities can be done
customer_reviews.text: We've used this board in various activities, and it is so helpful for children who are learning to count 1-100. Very visual and tactile

customer_reviews.title: Really great price, sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Really great price, sturdy product. Comes with a small bag to store the wood numbers. Great for a supervised use of manipulatives for toddlers for Montessori classroom without breaking the bank.

customer_reviews.title: I liked that it came with a little bag to hold ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought each square had raised edges, so that you could "nestle" each number into its place, but it doesn't. Otherwise, it is a bit small and a bit flimsy, but it does the job. I liked that it came with a little bag to hold the numbers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great number tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great number tool. My 3 yearsold girl is having fun and learning counting 1-100, and 5s 10s.

customer_reviews.title: Great for teaching your child the 100s or even 2s
customer_reviews.text: Great for teaching your child the 100s or even 2s,5s and 10s . Will be using this for my other children. Great price plus is like Montessori activity.
customer_reviews.author: Rick2550

customer_reviews.title: SMALL!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be the size of a small chess board. It is smaller than a Dr Suess book. It is still a nice idea and I am keeping it anyway, but damn it's so small. Probably cost less than $1 to make. They should sell for no more than $10.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Good concept but could be better!
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was bigger so the pieces wouldn’t get lost as easily, they are the size of scrabble pieces and once you lose one it’s kind of ruined. Also wish there were ridges the pieces fit into so they weren’t sliding all around. Other than that I really like it!

customer_reviews.title: Great Math learning tool
customer_reviews.text: Love this! My son is learning to count to 100 & this helps him recognize the numbers & learn sorting to help solve the numbers faster. Great lesson sorting by ones & 10's

customer_reviews.title: Pieces too small
customer_reviews.text: As others have written, the pieces are too small. Not suitable if there are younger siblings under 3 years old. I think it's great but we can only use it when the toddler is sleeping, which doesn't always coincide with when my 3 and 5 year olds are interested in playing with this.
customer_reviews.author: Simcha

customer_reviews.title: Not as big as expected
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than I thought. It is durable but wary of letting kindergartners use without watching closely

customer_reviews.title: It’s very appropriate for my math minded seven-year-old student, he really enjoys it.
customer_reviews.text: It’s very appropriate for my math minded seven-year-old student, he really enjoys it.

customer_reviews.text: I didn't know this would be such a hit, but my kindergarten students love it. It gets used every day! The bag that comes with it to hold the wooden pieces fell apart right away, but it was easy enough to replace with another bag I had. Otherwise, it's plenty sturdy.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Math Tool
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two for my kindergarten classroom. It is a new favorite math station. Pieces are quality wood and not too small.

customer_reviews.text: Perfect for homeschool. Great price. Would buy again. I like how the pieces come in a draw string bag.

product_meta.title: Amberetech Wooden Toys Hundred Board Montessori 1-100 Consecutive Numbers Wooden Educational Game for Kids with Storage Bag,Size 8.268.26inches
feature_bullets: 💖【THE SMALL PIECE OF WOOD BLOCKS SUCH AS THE SIZE OF A COIN】Please note that the Montessori hundred board has small size, especially designed for toddlers, easy for them to grasp, so it would be a little smaller than you expected them to be. So babies need more supervision when playing the hundred board. Please understand.

💖【MATERIAL-100% SAFETY WOOD】Perfect educational materials for preschool, elementary, kindergarten. Perfect educational toy to teach your children or pupils to count from 1 to 100. Help them to reinforce the sequence of 1 to 100.
💖【DIMENSION OF THE CONTROL BOARD-L=8.26inch, W=8.26inch, H=0.55inch】The portable size appropriate for outdoors, classroom and home use, convenient to carry around.

💖【MAKE BIG HELP TO YOUR KIDS ON MATH】Perfect educational materials for preschool, elementary, kindergarten.Perfect educational toy to teach your children or pupils to count from 1 to 100. Help them to reinforce the sequence of 1 to 100.
💖【PACKAGE DETAILS】Our 1-100 wooden board set include ❶A 100 grid digital card, ❷A control board, ❸1 to 100 wooden number cards, ❹A cloth storage bag, ❺ A colored paper boxes.
